body:
With single-band COGs, it may be possible to use dynamic capabilities (e.g. NRCan's datacube) to create streamable (i.e. cloud optimized) multiband images ready for training or inference.  GDL would then be presented with ready-to-use N-band images for sample creation/tiling.

This ticket is about N bands of one image.  The wider use case of N-band fused data (e.g. lidar resampled to an image gsd and used in conjunction with it for training) may be better addressed with a ready-to-use N-band image generation pre-processing step.

issue.title: Inference: refactoring needed

repository.name: geo-deep-learning
repository.description: Deep learning applied to georeferenced datasets

issue.body:
In preparation of issues #222 and #223, some refactoring is needed:
- use get_key_def to convert to pathlib.Path objects and to check existence of files/directories
- restore state_dict input to usage before #208 
- tracker: create set_tracker function to remove block of lines about tracker in inference_segmentation.py
- remove unused functions
- a few more minor things.

issue.title: Refactor inference and apply refactoring to other scripts

repository.name: geo-deep-learning
repository.description: Deep learning applied to georeferenced datasets

issue.body:
This PR makes no major changes to functionality and is mostly aimed at cleaning out some lenghty pieces of code in preparation for #222 #223. Result: net loss of over 200 lines of code :)

closes #265 

- utils.py: add to_path and validate_path_exists in get_key_def() and use
- logger.py: create set_tracker() function and use
- utils.py: create set_device() function and use (also checks if model can be pushed to device)
- remove unused ruamel_yaml dependency and yaml reader function (irrelevant with hydra)
> read_parameters() function and ruamel_yaml have been temporarily added to old scripts like data_analysis (#138 ) and gdl_hyperopt_template (#243 ) but ruamel_yaml is removed from environment.yaml since current scripts no longer rely on it.

- inference_segmentation.py: no parameters from training cfg inside script (use hydra)
- augmentations: complete usage of hydra for dontcare value (remove dontcare2background)
- utils.py and more: clean out other unused functions, imports and parameters

issue.title: Housecleaning

issue.body:
- remove unused functions
- remove ruamel_yaml import from active scripts
- fix dontcare2background related to PR #256

partially closes #265

body:
This issue is becoming a priority to address as the temporary [sample_creation.py](https://github.com/NRCan/geo-deep-learning/blob/develop/sample_creation.py) for tiling single-band imagery is getting more and more outdated.

Here's what I'd suggest to make a uniform tiling pipeline for both single-band ([stac item](https://github.com/NRCan/geo-deep-learning/issues/222) or not) and multi-band imagery. In the [proposed input csv ](https://github.com/NRCan/geo-deep-learning/issues/221#issuecomment-1121310523), the imagery path could be in one of three formats:
1. path to a multi-band image file:
`my_dir/my_multiband_geofile.tif`

2. path to a single-band image file, where the band specific string in the file name would be in a hydra-like [interpolation format](https://hydra.cc/docs/1.0/advanced/override_grammar/basic/#primitives). The interpolation string would refer to a dataset parameter with a list of desired band names or strings to help resolve the single-band filenames. For example:
in dataset config:
`dataset.bands: [R, G, B]`
in input csv:
`my_dir/my_singleband_geofile_band_${dataset.bands}.tif`
The tiling script would therefore combine, in the same order as bands appear in dataset config, the following files:
`my_dir/my_singleband_geofile_band_R.tif`
`my_dir/my_singleband_geofile_band_G.tif`
`my_dir/my_singleband_geofile_band_B.tif`

We'd then use torchgeo's machinery [to merge these singleband files](https://github.com/microsoft/torchgeo/blob/9f96cdd47293f1de7fc4486c60c632f9b895198e/torchgeo/datasets/geo.py#L434) as is done [in the 222-stac-item-input branch](https://github.com/remtav/geo-deep-learning/blob/222-stac-item-input/inference/InferenceDataset.py#L186).

3.  a stac item referring to singleband assets. Bands would be selected by [common name in dataset config](https://github.com/remtav/geo-deep-learning/blob/222-stac-item-input/config/dataset/ccmeo_datacube_dataset.yaml#L13):
`https://datacube-stage.services.geo.ca/api/collections/spacenet-samples/items/SpaceNet_AOI_2_Las_Vegas-056155973080_01_P001-WV03`

FYI, issues would most probably be tackled in the following order: #221 , #222, #223, #215, #300 
This would also close the following issues: #139, #167
I think the suggested solution works!

issue.title: Common input pipeline for single- and multi-band imagery and AOI object for input data

repository.name: geo-deep-learning
repository.description: Deep learning applied to georeferenced datasets

issue.body:
aoi.py: 
- create an AOI object with input validation. AOI would be the core input for tiling, training and inference, though only yet implemented for tiling.
- add stac item support
geoutils.py:
- add utils: is_stac_item, stack_vrts() for create artificial multi-band raster from single-bands files
test_aoi.py: add first test for parsing raster input from 3 types to a single rasterio.RasterDataset object
default.yaml: activate debug functionality for logging
test_ci_segmentation_multiclass.yaml: replace 'modalities' with 'bands' key
test_ci_segmentation_binary.yaml: idem
sample_creation.py: delete
utils.py: remove validation from read_csv() function.

fixes #223

issue.title: Add support for checkpoint and imagery inputs as url

repository.name: geo-deep-learning
repository.description: Deep learning applied to georeferenced datasets

issue.body:
fixes #317 
- adds unit tests for 3 different types of input imagery to AOI object: multiband, singleband and stac item (with inhouse format, since there's no standard yet...)
- also extends PR #223:
    - allow stac item input imagery to be written as local multiband raster (currently only local singleband imagery is supported as input)
    - add "filter geodataframe by attribute" feature
    - during creation of AOI object, check if at least one feature remains after filtering (i.e. include this check as part of data validation in AOI's \_\_init__)
